messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Jobs and Staying Home
messages.msgSnippet: Sonia: My husband has all that MCSE stuff and CNE as well.  Now his BA this Saturday.  Don t give up hope of him making more money.  When Steve started out in
messages.messageBody:
Sonia:

My husband has all that MCSE stuff and CNE as well. Now his BA this
Saturday. Don't give up hope of him making more money. When Steve started
out in the industry 4 years ago and knew nothing he earned $10 per hour.
After 9 months he took at job that paid $12. He then took at regular job
paying $26,000 per year. 8 months after that he took a job paying $32,000.
1 year after that he took a job paying $42,000. 3 months ago he took a job
paying $55,000 and people say the Computer Industry doesn't pay in Tucson.
All through this my husband self studied and went to the University of
Phoenix one night a week. He took every MCSE and CNE test. He's now a
Network Manager. The next move will be IT Director or out of State to
possibly Washington for better weather and a better way of life. The good
thing about computers is that you keep moving up and no one seems to care
whether you've been somewhere for only 1 year or not. It seems to be
expected.

Think about what you can do at home and turn it into a business. If you want
to e-mail me privately I'll be more than happy to help you with this as
that's what I do for a living. Help people figure out what they want to do
and then show them the resources to do it.

Dawn F
